events.name: UK Inflation Hits New High in October Due to Rising Energy Costs
events.wd_label: UK Inflation Hits New High in October Due to Rising Energy Costs
events.wd_description: The UK's inflation rate rose to 11.1% in October, driven by soaring energy costs, as the economy slides into recession, with living costs sharply increasing despite government intervention.
events.description: The UK's inflation rate rose to 11.1% in October, driven by soaring energy costs, as the economy slides into recession, with living costs sharply increasing despite government intervention.

events.name: Inflation Increase
events.wd_description: The UK's annual inflation rate rose to 11.1% in October, up from 10.1% in September, marking a new high driven by rising energy and food prices.
events.description: The UK's annual inflation rate rose to 11.1% in October, up from 10.1% in September, marking a new high driven by rising energy and food prices.

events.name: Energy Price Surge
events.wd_description: Soaring gas and electricity prices, with gas prices rising nearly 130% and electricity by 66%, have significantly contributed to the sharp increase in the cost of living.
events.description: Soaring gas and electricity prices, with gas prices rising nearly 130% and electricity by 66%, have significantly contributed to the sharp increase in the cost of living.

events.name: Economic Recession Projection
events.wd_description: The UK economy is projected to remain in recession through the first quarter of 2024, as confirmed by recent data showing economic contraction in the third quarter.
events.description: The UK economy is projected to remain in recession through the first quarter of 2024, as confirmed by recent data showing economic contraction in the third quarter.

events.name: Putin Signs Law to Mobilize Convicted Criminals for Military Service
events.wd_label: Putin Signs Law to Mobilize Convicted Criminals for Military Service
events.wd_description: Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a law allowing the conscription of citizens with serious criminal convictions to be mobilized for military service, potentially increasing the number of mobilized soldiers in the war in Ukraine.
events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a law allowing the conscription of citizens with serious criminal convictions to be mobilized for military service, potentially increasing the number of mobilized soldiers in the war in Ukraine.

events.name: New Mobilization Law
events.wd_description: The law signed by Putin allows citizens with convictions for serious crimes, including murder and drug trafficking, to be conscripted for military service, enabling the mobilization of hundreds of thousands of people.
events.description: The law signed by Putin allows citizens with convictions for serious crimes, including murder and drug trafficking, to be conscripted for military service, enabling the mobilization of hundreds of thousands of people.

events.name: Increased Mobilization Numbers
events.wd_description: Putin announced that an additional 18,000 soldiers had already been mobilized, exceeding the initial target of 300,000, with conscriptions now including those with serious criminal records.
events.description: Putin announced that an additional 18,000 soldiers had already been mobilized, exceeding the initial target of 300,000, with conscriptions now including those with serious criminal records.

events.name: Partial Mobilization Continuation
events.wd_description: Despite earlier announcements of the suspension of partial mobilization, Putin's partial mobilization order remains in effect until he signs an official decree to end it.
events.description: Despite earlier announcements of the suspension of partial mobilization, Putin's partial mobilization order remains in effect until he signs an official decree to end it.

events.name: Shooting at Kurdish Cultural Centre in Paris
events.wd_label: Shooting at Kurdish Cultural Centre in Paris
events.wd_description: A gunman opened fire at a Kurdish Cultural Centre in central Paris, killing three people and wounding others, in what is suspected to be a far-right motivated attack.
events.description: A gunman opened fire at a Kurdish Cultural Centre in central Paris, killing three people and wounding others, in what is suspected to be a far-right motivated attack.

events.name: Shooting Incident
events.wd_description: A gunman targeted the Kurdish Cultural Centre in central Paris, killing three people and injuring others, with the attack appearing to be directed at the Kurdish community.
events.description: A gunman targeted the Kurdish Cultural Centre in central Paris, killing three people and injuring others, with the attack appearing to be directed at the Kurdish community.

events.name: Kurdish Democratic Council's Response
events.wd_description: The Kurdish Democratic Council condemned the attack and announced that a vigil would be held to pay tribute to those killed.
events.description: The Kurdish Democratic Council condemned the attack and announced that a vigil would be held to pay tribute to those killed.

events.name: Paris Mayor's Statement
events.wd_description: Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo suggested that the attack was carried out by a far-right activist, expressing solidarity with the Kurdish community in Paris.
events.description: Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo suggested that the attack was carried out by a far-right activist, expressing solidarity with the Kurdish community in Paris.

events.name: Murder Investigation
events.wd_description: Prosecutors in Paris have launched a murder investigation into the shooting, seeking to determine the motives and background of the attacker.
events.description: Prosecutors in Paris have launched a murder investigation into the shooting, seeking to determine the motives and background of the attacker.

events.name: Biden Administration's $2.8 Billion Grants for EV Battery Supply Chain
events.wd_label: Biden Administration's $2.8 Billion Grants for EV Battery Supply Chain
events.wd_description: President Joe Biden announced $2.8 billion in grants to boost the electric vehicle battery supply chain, funding projects to produce battery-grade materials and reduce dependence on foreign suppliers.
events.description: President Joe Biden announced $2.8 billion in grants to boost the electric vehicle battery supply chain, funding projects to produce battery-grade materials and reduce dependence on foreign suppliers.

events.name: Grant Announcements
events.wd_description: The $2.8 billion grants come from the infrastructure law and will fund projects across multiple states to produce battery-grade materials.
events.description: The $2.8 billion grants come from the infrastructure law and will fund projects across multiple states to produce battery-grade materials.

events.name: Projects and Investments
events.wd_description: Funded projects include efforts to make enough lithium and graphite to supply millions of EVs annually, and create an electrode binder facility to meet future demand.
events.description: Funded projects include efforts to make enough lithium and graphite to supply millions of EVs annually, and create an electrode binder facility to meet future demand.

events.name: American Battery Technology Project
events.wd_description: Developing a new process to extract and refine lithium from a sedimentary deposit in Nevada through the American Battery Technology Company.
events.description: Developing a new process to extract and refine lithium from a sedimentary deposit in Nevada through the American Battery Technology Company.

events.name: Cirba Solutions Project
events.wd_description: Expanding and upgrading Cirba Solutions’ existing lithium-ion recycling facility in Lancaster, Ohio to produce more lithium.
events.description: Expanding and upgrading Cirba Solutions’ existing lithium-ion recycling facility in Lancaster, Ohio to produce more lithium.

events.name: Ascend Elements Project
events.wd_description: Constructing a cathode active materials (CAM) plant at a greenfield site in Hopkinsville, Kentucky.
events.description: Constructing a cathode active materials (CAM) plant at a greenfield site in Hopkinsville, Kentucky.

events.name: Albemarle Project
events.wd_description: Constructing a new, commercial-scale U.S.-based lithium materials processing plant at Kings Mountain, North Carolina.
events.description: Constructing a new, commercial-scale U.S.-based lithium materials processing plant at Kings Mountain, North Carolina.

events.name: Anovion Project
events.wd_description: Expanding Anovion's Sanborn, New York manufacturing into Alabama with a new graphite manufacturing facility.
events.description: Expanding Anovion's Sanborn, New York manufacturing into Alabama with a new graphite manufacturing facility.

events.name: American Battery Materials Initiative
events.wd_description: The initiative aims to strengthen battery material and mineral supply chains through coordination with tribal nations and international partners.
events.description: The initiative aims to strengthen battery material and mineral supply chains through coordination with tribal nations and international partners.
